intro: Selago gillii, commonly known as the mountain selago, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Selago gillii thrives in rocky, arid environments and is often found in mountainous regions. Its botanical features make it well adapted to harsh, high-altitude conditions.
